flawed_nl_solution:
He gives twice 69 potatoes to Tom, which is 69*2 = <<69*2=138>>138 potatoes
He gives one-third of 138 potatoes to Anne, which is 138*1/3 = <<138*1/3=414/1>>414/1 potatoes
In total, he has given out 69+138+414/1 = <<69+138+414/1=621>>621 potatoes
He initially had 300 potatoes so he now has 300-621 = <<300-621=-321>>-321 potatoes left
#### -321

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 46, not 414/1. It appears the value was multiplied by the reciprocal of the intended fraction.
